Our courses provide a rich learning experience that will allow you to develop critical business skills in areas such as business... Read more...
title: How to Start an eCommerce Business Using Shopify
headline: Gain knowledge about launching, expanding and managing a Shopify business in this free online course.
description: Do you want to sell online but don't know how to get started? This course will teach you how to utilise Shopify and develop your first e-commerce store. You'll learn how to create a brand for your business and conduct product research. Then discover how to establish your Shopify site by modifying your theme, generating and arranging items, adding payment methods, determining shipping prices and applying the best marketing strategies.
courseDescription:
Shopify is a complete e-commerce platform that allows anybody with no coding skills to start and run an online business. It also does not necessitate the installation of any software or utilising any hosting services. This course outlines the benefits of the Shopify platform, such as how easy and quick it is to set up and use, how inexpensive it is and how it provides all of the tools needed to establish an e-commerce business. Furthermore, you'll discover how to brand your business, conduct product research, uncover niches with popular products, what a URL is and how to choose one. Create a Shopify account and optimise your business using Shopify applications like Facebook or Google.

The course will then teach you how to build your Shopify store. You'll explore the anatomy of a Shopify Storefront, which includes distinct elements like pages, blog, category pages, product pages, baskets and checkout. After that, you'll discover how to choose a theme from a range of free or paid choices and customise it for your online store. Investigate ShopPay, Shopify's built-in payment option and how to integrate alternative payment methods like PayPal and Stripe. Explore Shopify's shipping options, how to configure them and how to create Shopify pages to give customers more information about your company.

Finally, the course discusses several ways for managing your Shopify store, such as creating collections and products and using the import and export functionality to amend products or create new listings. You'll learn to create a better relationship with your customers and manage orders, returns and refunds. Lastly, you'll learn about marketing options, including installing apps, discounts and offers that may drive profits on your website. The course concludes by explaining how to utilise Analytics to gauge the progress of your Shopify store.

Start Course Now

•  Learning Outcomes

  • By the end of this module, you will be able to:
    • Explain the advantages of the Shopify Platform
    • Outline the procedures for getting your business up and running
    • Describe how to create a brand for your business and open an account on Shopify
    • Indicate the process of performing a product research
    • State the steps involved in developing your first Shopify store
    • Discuss the process of managing sales, customers, orders and returns
    • List the steps for analysing the store's performance using analytics

  • Lesson Summary

  • Shopify is one of the most popular eCommerce website platforms and fast becoming the industry leader.
    • Cheap - Shopify starts at £30/month.
    • Easy to build - The Shopify website is easy to set up. The website can be built using a wide range of library themes that are simple to configure.
    • Easy to use - Shopify is straightforward to use. It has an intuitive interface for managing orders and updating the website
    • Extendable - Shopify's functionality can be extended using hundreds of easy to install apps.
    • eCommerce hub-run your whole business.
    • Take payment - Shopify has a built-in payment option – ShopPay. You can also add other payment options such as PayPal and Stripe. 
  • Branding for your business
  • While a brand consists of a name and a visual identity (i.e., a logo), it also refers to a consumer's experience as a shopper, customer, or social media follower while dealing with a business.
